page.title: 08THE INSTITUTE GLYN CEIRIOG.
page.content: The Ceiriog Memorial Institute in Glyn Ceiriog was founded in 1911 and it was opened on the 25th May of that year by Lord Davies of Llandinam.The Institute embodies:A lasting Memorial to the poet "Ceiriog"and other notable Welsh men.It is sometimes used as a village hall for meetings, concerts, lectures, etc.There is a club ( with reading, billiards,smoke and games rooms) for the inhabitants of the district and visitors. It is also a local museum and art gallery. It is a court house for Magistrates and it is a meeting place for the local Authorities and local organisations. It is used by the Womens Institute, Merched y Wawr etc. Also there is a dwelling house (five rooms)for the resident caretaker.
